009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
015import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
016import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
017
018import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * ImageJ plugin for a simple 3Ã—3 linear smoothing filter. The filter kernel is defined as a 2D array of type
023 * {@code double}. The coordinate origin of the filter is assumed at the center of the matrix (i.e., at array position
024 * [1, 1]), which is accounted for by an offset of 1 for the i, j coordinates in inner filter loop. The results are
025 * rounded and stored in the original image (ip). Note that the border pixels are not modified. See Sec. 4.2 (Prog. 4.2)
026 * of [1] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
030 * (2022).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author WB
034 */
035public class Filter_Smooth_3x3 implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
036
037        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
038        public Filter_Smooth_3x3() {
039                if (noCurrentImage()) {
040                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.IrishManor);
041                }
042        }
043
044    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
045        return DOES_8G;
046    }
047
048    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
049        int M = ip.getWidth();
050        int N = ip.getHeight();
051
052        // 3x3 filter kernel (sums to 1)
053        double[][] H = {
054                        {0.075, 0.125, 0.075},
055                        {0.125, 0.200, 0.125},
056                        {0.075, 0.125, 0.075}};
057
058        ImageProcessor copy = ip.duplicate();
059
060        for (int u = 1; u <= M - 2; u++) {
061                for (int v = 1; v <= N - 2; v++) {
062                        // compute filter result for position (u,v):
063                        double sum = 0;
064                        for (int i = -1; i <= 1; i++) {
065                                for (int j = -1; j <= 1; j++) {
066                                        int p = copy.get(u + i, v + j);
067                                        // get the corresponding filter coefficient:
068                                        double c = H[j + 1][i + 1];
069                                        sum = sum + c * p;
070                                }
071                        }
072                        int q = (int) Math.round(sum);
073                        ip.set(u, v, q);
074                }
075        }
076    }
077
078}
